intro: Quadrella antonensis, commonly known as the Antoni's quadrella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
